title: Improve Vec::extend(repeat(once)) error output

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=9bcb7aee0de0df58f05d8154a14ff96f

```rust
    let mut buffer: Vec<u8> = vec![];
    buffer.extend(
        std::iter::repeat(
            std::iter::once(0)  
        )
        .take(10)
    );
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `Vec<u8>: Extend<std::iter::Once<{integer}>>` is not satisfied
 --> src/lib.rs:3:12
  |
3 |     buffer.extend(
  |            ^^^^^^ the trait `Extend<std::iter::Once<{integer}>>` is not implemented for `Vec<u8>`
  |
  = help: the following implementations were found:
            <Vec<T, A> as Extend<&'a T>>
            <Vec<T, A> as Extend<T>>
```


Not sure what Ideally the output should look like, maybe somehow detect the "once" here is not necessary and suggest removing it. The output is the same on nightly
